problem_text:
20.90. A profinite group in which all centralizers of non-trivial elements are pronilpotent is called a CN-group. Find an example of a finitely generated infinite profinite CN-group which is not prosoluble.
The structure of profinite CN-groups is described in (P. Shumyatsky, Israel J. Math., 235, no. 1 (2020), 325–347).
P. Shumyatsky
